column4: is it possible to switch back and forth between kde and gnome?
can i 'test' out kde on my system and the remove it to go back to gnome?
im on 9.10 shoudl that matter? Losha?
you're still on Hardy?
wow
why not switch?
b/c people like to have the latest and greatest
delac? really
is kde 'heavier' than gnome?
as far a memory is concerned YES kde is heavier then gnome
a comparison of the various DEs using 10.04 http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=article&item=linux_desktop_vitals&num=1
are you using UNE (the netbook edition?)
is this about the button settings?
well yes and no
using the following should set default for the buttons key -- gconftool-2 --set "/apps/metacity/general/button_layout" --type string "close,minimize,maximize:"
ahh you need to set it to writable
how do i set it to writable. im a bit of an ubuntu n00b.
gconf-editor and browse to the key in question, then right click on button_layout and see if "mandatory" is selected
tells me to 'set as mandatory"
are you opening gconf-editor as root (with gksudo or sudo)?  If i use gksudo then it shows the key as "non-writable" but when i open with my user it is.
never use sudo with GUI applications!
noooo
k
